channel.title: [WIP] Modeling my room
channel.description:
So before anyone asks, MY ROOM IS EFFING SHAPED WIERD (hence why I felt like modeling it so badly :P ) Anyways, I only have the basic structure of the room done, minus the cieling. I will likely just export it and model my furniture in Metasequoia, Blender, or 3DS Max (if I can bother to learn how to use it). So without further ado, here's the blueprint of my room remade in Sketchup: (yes, it is 3D, just a top view)
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/mrGOg.png[/img]
The dimensions of my room are near-exact, as I pre-measured my walls, window frames, door frames, and closets. The only real difference is that my closets expand further outwards (not deep) that I made them. But meh, I'll fix it later :rolleyes:
My next step: fixing the model, as the inside faces are invisible, but the outer faces are just peachy.
